Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. Five line inscription. Piece of rim projecting. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London., 187; Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 320; Launois, Aimée. 1959. ‘Estampilles et poids musulmans en verre du Cabinet des Médailles’ II. Cairo, 27; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 449-50. Cf. Miles, G.C. 1951. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps: a supplement’. New York, 22; Miles, G.C. 1958. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ I. New York, 137-9; Miles, G.C. 1971. ‘Umayyad and ʿAbbasid glass weights and measure stamps in the Corning Museum’. Corning, 21; Balog 1976, 448, 451.

A single specimen of the qist has been published (Balog 1976, 445). This series would have been one of those used with Yazīd b. Ḥātim's command stamp, at least part of the time (see OA+ 4079-4080). Bibliography: Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York..
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (231)
Associated names: Named in inscription: 'Abd al-Raḥmān b. Yazīd
